events.name: Global Heatwave and Wildfire Impact
events.wd_description: Unprecedented high temperatures and widespread wildfires were reported globally, with record-breaking heat in the U.K. and fires causing evacuations in several countries.
events.description: Unprecedented high temperatures and widespread wildfires were reported globally, with record-breaking heat in the U.K. and fires causing evacuations in several countries.

events.name: High Temperatures
events.wd_description: Record-breaking temperatures of 40C were reported in the U.K., with similar heatwaves affecting regions across North America and beyond.
events.description: Record-breaking temperatures of 40C were reported in the U.K., with similar heatwaves affecting regions across North America and beyond.

events.name: Wildfires
events.wd_description: Wildfires prompted evacuations in France, Portugal, Spain, and other areas, with smoke and soot causing visibility issues as far as Argentina and Paraguay.
events.description: Wildfires prompted evacuations in France, Portugal, Spain, and other areas, with smoke and soot causing visibility issues as far as Argentina and Paraguay.

events.name: Climate Change Effects
events.wd_description: Experts link increased vegetation flammability and soil dryness to climate change, advising governments to plan for rising temperatures, with a noted reduction in wildfires due to changes in land use in Africa.
events.description: Experts link increased vegetation flammability and soil dryness to climate change, advising governments to plan for rising temperatures, with a noted reduction in wildfires due to changes in land use in Africa.

events.name: Ukraine gains ground in Kharkiv counteroffensive
events.wd_label: Ukraine gains ground in Kharkiv counteroffensive
events.wd_description: Ukrainian military confirmed significant gains in a counteroffensive in the north-eastern Kharkiv region, with President Zelenskiy announcing the reclamation of a vital city and repelling Russian offensives.
events.description: Ukrainian military confirmed significant gains in a counteroffensive in the north-eastern Kharkiv region, with President Zelenskiy announcing the reclamation of a vital city and repelling Russian offensives.

events.name: Zelenskiy's announcement
events.wd_description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy announced that Ukrainian forces have reclaimed a vital city in the Kharkiv region and are repelling Russian offensives across the country.
events.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy announced that Ukrainian forces have reclaimed a vital city in the Kharkiv region and are repelling Russian offensives across the country.

events.name: video of Ukrainian soldiers
events.wd_description: Zelenskiy posted a video of Ukrainian soldiers standing above a building in Balakliia, held by the Russians for six months, with the Ukrainian flag.
events.description: Zelenskiy posted a video of Ukrainian soldiers standing above a building in Balakliia, held by the Russians for six months, with the Ukrainian flag.

events.name: reclamation of Balakliia
events.wd_description: Ukrainian forces reclaimed the key city of Balakliia in the Kharkiv region, which had been held by Russian forces for six months.
events.description: Ukrainian forces reclaimed the key city of Balakliia in the Kharkiv region, which had been held by Russian forces for six months.

events.name: Ukrainian troops reaching Kupyansk
events.wd_description: Ukrainian troops reached the city of Kupyansk, a key logistics and supply hub for Russian forces, though the city is yet to be fully retaken by Ukrainian forces.
events.description: Ukrainian troops reached the city of Kupyansk, a key logistics and supply hub for Russian forces, though the city is yet to be fully retaken by Ukrainian forces.

events.name: EU launches legal action against the UK over Northern Ireland protocol bill
events.wd_label: EU launches legal action against the UK over Northern Ireland protocol bill
events.wd_description: The European Union expressed anger over the UK's legislation overriding the post-Brexit arrangement for Northern Ireland and launched four legal cases against the UK government.
events.description: The European Union expressed anger over the UK's legislation overriding the post-Brexit arrangement for Northern Ireland and launched four legal cases against the UK government.

events.name: protocol bill approval
events.wd_description: The Northern Ireland protocol bill was approved at its third hearing in the House of Commons by 267 votes to 195 and will proceed to the House of Lords in the autumn.
events.description: The Northern Ireland protocol bill was approved at its third hearing in the House of Commons by 267 votes to 195 and will proceed to the House of Lords in the autumn.

events.name: EU legal action
events.wd_description: The European Union launched four legal cases against the UK government in response to the passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill.
events.description: The European Union launched four legal cases against the UK government in response to the passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill.

events.name: potential fines
events.wd_description: The EU court has the power to impose multimillion-euro fines on the UK, potentially leading to punitive action through Brexit deal mechanisms.
events.description: The EU court has the power to impose multimillion-euro fines on the UK, potentially leading to punitive action through Brexit deal mechanisms.

events.name: EU commission statement
events.wd_description: The European Commission stated that the legal action was partly due to the continued passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill, which goes against the spirit of collective solutions.
events.description: The European Commission stated that the legal action was partly due to the continued passage of the Northern Ireland protocol bill, which goes against the spirit of collective solutions.

events.name: Ford's EV battery supply chain strategy
events.wd_label: Ford's EV battery supply chain strategy
events.wd_description: Ford is enhancing its battery supply chain by incorporating lower-cost, iron-based batteries from China and securing raw material supplies to boost electric vehicle production.
events.description: Ford is enhancing its battery supply chain by incorporating lower-cost, iron-based batteries from China and securing raw material supplies to boost electric vehicle production.

events.name: short-term goals
events.wd_description: Ford aims to produce 600,000 EVs annually by 2023, supported by its strategy to use cheaper and more abundant LFP batteries.
events.description: Ford aims to produce 600,000 EVs annually by 2023, supported by its strategy to use cheaper and more abundant LFP batteries.

events.name: t: increasing EV production
events.wd_description: Ford plans to increase its EV production from 27,140 units to 600,000 units annually by 2023.
events.description: Ford plans to increase its EV production from 27,140 units to 600,000 units annually by 2023.

events.name: t: importing LFP batteries
events.wd_description: Ford will import LFP battery packs from China’s CATL for its Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning starting next year.
events.description: Ford will import LFP battery packs from China’s CATL for its Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning starting next year.

events.name: long-term goals
events.wd_description: Ford aims to produce 2 million EVs annually by 2026, with plans to establish a 40-GWh LFP cell factory in North America and reduce reliance on nickel and cobalt-based batteries.
events.description: Ford aims to produce 2 million EVs annually by 2026, with plans to establish a 40-GWh LFP cell factory in North America and reduce reliance on nickel and cobalt-based batteries.

events.name: t: domestic LFP production
events.wd_description: Ford plans to open a 40-GWh LFP cell factory in North America by 2026.
events.description: Ford plans to open a 40-GWh LFP cell factory in North America by 2026.

events.name: t: reducing reliance on nickel and cobalt
events.wd_label: t: reducing reliance on nickel and cobalt
events.wd_description: Ford is shifting to iron-based LFP batteries to avoid supply issues related to nickel and cobalt.
events.description: Ford is shifting to iron-based LFP batteries to avoid supply issues related to nickel and cobalt.

events.name: supplier deals and partnerships
events.wd_description: Ford has announced several supplier deals and partnerships to secure raw materials and battery components directly from mining companies.
events.description: Ford has announced several supplier deals and partnerships to secure raw materials and battery components directly from mining companies.

events.name: t: direct sourcing from mining companies
events.wd_label: t: direct sourcing from mining companies
events.wd_description: Ford has secured contracts to buy raw materials directly from mining companies to ensure a steady supply for battery production.
events.description: Ford has secured contracts to buy raw materials directly from mining companies to ensure a steady supply for battery production.

events.name: t: diversification of battery chemistry
events.wd_description: Ford is adding LFP battery chemistry alongside its existing NCM chemistry to diversify its battery options and reduce costs.
events.description: Ford is adding LFP battery chemistry alongside its existing NCM chemistry to diversify its battery options and reduce costs.
